hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Regime Shift
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC 20-day realized volatility compresses below 30% while price consolidates within a 5% range for 14+ days during a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the consolidation high with 2x average volume will signal transition to BULL regime with 70% probability, while breakdown below consolidation low with 2x volume signals BEAR regime transition.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility consolidation represents pent-up energy. High-volume breakouts from such compressions often mark regime shifts as new information gets priced in. The volume confirmation filters false breakouts.
entry_conditions: BTC price range (high-low)/low < 5% for 14 consecutive days
Break above 14-day high with volume > 200% of 20D average (BULL entry)
Break below 14-day low with volume > 200% of 20D average (BEAR entry)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Return to consolidation range for 2 consecutive days

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of high-volume breakouts from volatility compression fail to sustain new regime characteristics (trend persistence, volatility expansion) within 7 days.
